data.title: Junior Council - 2024 The Week Junior
data.meta_description: A weekly magazine for kids ages 8–14. Current events, science, nature, animals, technology.
data.text:
Meet our 2024 Junior Council members!

These 12 amazing kids were selected from a pool of outstanding applicants from all across the country. They spent four months discussing and debating important issues, engaging with experts and elected officials, and created content for an issue of The Week Junior.

Terms & Conditions

Privacy

Junior Council Privacy

Junior Council Official Rules

Annika, age 8 From New Jersey

“Children should influence their parents to make eco-friendly choices.”

Minerva, age 9 From New York

“I want to empower kids to feel confident and stand up to bullies.”

Aiden, age 10 From Washington

“Stopping wildfires is important to me.”

Aleen, age 10 From Pennsylvania

“Kids will impact the future, so watch out for us.”

Eden, age 11 From North Carolina

“No child should be homeless or hungry.”

Hannah, age 9 From Connecticut

“I am passionate about animals and endangered species.”

Thomas, age 10 From California

“Kids can make big changes to improve our planet.”

Nicholas, age 11 From New York

“The world needs more compassion, empathy, and understanding.”

Vivaan, age 13 From Alabama

“Nobody is born a leader. We learn to become one.”

Aryn, age 12 From Texas

“Everyone should be able to write freely and read freely.”

Brennan, age 11 From Montana

“I really want world peace.”

Steven, age 11 From California

“Having our voices heard makes us feel valued and civically engaged.”

Roll over their pictures to see what's important to them.

See Junior Council Stories

What is Junior Council?

Junior Council is a collective of 12 students, ages 8 to 14, who learn from The Week Junior editors and mentors about how to become strong voices in their community—and beyond.

Through webinars and workshops, Junior Council members discover how to develop informed opinions and turn their ideas into action. They receive age-appropriate research and writing assignments, gain interview experience, engage community leaders in conversations, and collaborate with one another to produce content for the magazine.

What does the Junior Council do?

Meet our mentors

To help shape the Junior Council experience, our editors created a team of experts from various vocations to offer guidance to council members. Here is some advice from current and former mentors on how kids can help make a difference in the world.

Empowering kids to speak up on issues that matter to them

Empowering kids to speak up on issues that matter to them

Apply Now

What is the Junior Journalist program?

Upon completion of the program, Junior Council members become eligible to participate in our Junior Journalist program. They may be assigned to cover events or to conduct interviews with experts or noteworthy people.

Apply now! Deadline 10/23

What is the Junior Journalist program?

Upon completion of the program, Junior Council members become eligible to participate in our Junior Journalist program. They may be assigned to cover events or to conduct interviews with experts or noteworthy people.

Apply now! Deadline 10/23

Junior Journalists at work

Symphony speaks with former First Lady of the United States Michelle Obama, about her TV series, Waffles and Mochi

Augustus interviews John Salley at the premiere of Sneakerella

Alexandra interviews Janet Woodcock, M.D., former United States Acting Commissioner of Food and Drug, about children's Covid-19 vaccines

Junior Council members interview chef, author, and TV host Duff Goldman about his career

Aarav interviews United States Speed Skater Erin Jackson, following her gold-medal win at the 2022 Olympic Winter Games

Junior Council members discuss Covid-19 vaccines with GMA3’s Dr. Jen Ashton

Olivia interviews Liya Chu, winner of MasterChef Junior Season 8

Aarav covers the 2022 Scripps National Spelling Bee, alongside Andrea Barbalich, Editor-in-Chief of The Week Junior

Aarav interviews 2022 Scripps National Spelling Bee Champion Harini Logan

Junior Council members on GMA3

Members of our Fall 2021 Junior Council appeared on GMA3, asking questions about the COVID-19 vaccine for children. Check out the segment:
